title: Lets talk about blind pick normals Riot
body:
So currently we have blind pick norms in which lanes are decided through "calling them first" in chat, but over the years I've come to the conclusion that this is a really unhealthy and stupid process of organising team positions. Now I know you tried to fix the problem in ranked matches with the "role selectors" which honestly was the right way to go, but for people who play norms the majority of the time having to deal with this utter mess of team management is frustrating. I find myself every time I queue up to play I have my fingers on "top" ready to race against the other players to type in chat as fast as I can and we run into all these issues such as buggy chats with people arguing over who called the lane first and people who just instalock a lane because they can't be bothered trying to "call their lane". Ever since you released the role selector for ranked matches it feels like you left all the norms players in the dirt having to continue to put up with this horrible system. So I ask you, why do we need to have blind pick in the first place? Why can we not just have draft mode for both ranked and normal? I have never liked or enjoyed blind pick but I need to practise my champs a lot for when I play ranked so I have to pray whenever I queue up that I manage to call my lane otherwise I'm wasting 30 minutes of my time, because that's the only reason I play. And yes, I would queue up and wait 10-15 minutes if it guarantees that I get my lane, I honestly couldn't care about queue times as long as I don't have to start arguing with my team before the game even starts.

Please hear me out Riot this is a serious issue that I've discussed quite a bit with the community of people who are fed up with this unhealthy system :(

replies.body: It would also allow the client to accurately analyze your data for rank etc for supports that are also laners, off roles for the champin top or jg (cs, wards etc) Lux support vs lane, voli lane vs jg, etc etc.

In one of the latest patch notes, I suggested (admittedly in probably the wrong spot) that when the champ select pops up, it shows a lane assignment map similar to the ranked display that allows to to select the role you want. Then it'd be first clicked first served, and get rid of the cancerous I picked first, no I did, on my screen blah blah feed.

I like the idea.

If you don't get the role you want just play another one after. You say you like to practice your lane in norms for ranked. If this is the case then you would get good practice from trying out other roles as well, even if that means you have to support a few times. Even if you play ranked you're not guaranteed one of your two preferred roles so you might as well try and perfect them all.

Oh and they're not going to bring Normal Draft back since they're removing it from all regions.

I'm pretty sure the majority of the community is over autofill so it's unlikely Riot are gonna keep using it. And I play League to have fun and when I'm playing support I'm not having fun so sorry but I'd rather dodge then waste 30 minutes of my life.

They tested on LAN and LAS the option to choose one role you didnt want to play, and it shot queue times up by 20 mins so they are looking for other options. Autofill is here tp stay for a good while yet.

I'm on mobile so it's hard to find the links, but Maraudaur made a post recently with a good link about why players don't like support.

role calling creates toxicity
RIOT doesnt seem to care
keep banning support singed!!!

Draft mode is being removed from all regions to maintain the health of the two ranked queues we now have, so we will not be getting draft pick. We may at some point in the future (if it happens most likely after the full release of the new client) get the role selection feature of NCS for blind normals, however there are no guarantees.

This makes no sense! Draft prepares people for ranked. How're you meant to practice a role if you never get it?
Exactly what I'm saying there needs to be a better way then "calling your lane in chat" it's so stupid, random and unorganised.

Draft pick refers specifically to the banning phase, NCS (New Champion Select) itself refers to the means of picking roles before entering champ select (i.e in lobby). When NCS came out Riot voiced their intentions to bring it to norms as well, but things got pretty hectic with dynamic queue LCU and now the two new ranked queues.

Chances are it will happen, but it's not a Soon (TM) at this point, more of an eventually.

when you have 2 roles that are highly desirable, 2 roles that are moderately desirable and a role that people rarely want to play and is usually last call it becomes fairly obvious how shitty a game is going to be just from the pre chat.

most games 4/5 calling mid and top and 1/20 people actually calling for support. support is just a boring gated role for most(not all,myself included) people, lets face it.

most of the times due to this fact most of the games just devolve into one person turning the whole game into a clown fiesta because they didnt get the role they wanted.

at the moment the games i don't enjoy probably outweigh the games i enjoy by about 10-1. its fucking sad and this crappy outdated system just adds fuel to the fire.
